arts.ttl: Player Ratings Poll: Shakhtar Donetsk 1 - 5 Bayern Munich (UEFA Champions League)
arts.sum: Player Ratings Vote ( view results ) Player ratings [ @BILD ] pic.twitter.com/ZFkDSQDUc9

arts.ttl: Daily Schmankerl: The aftermath of Bayern Munich vs. Shakhtar Donetsk in the Champions League; Bayern in the mix with FC Barcelona, Real Madrid, PSG for Manchester City star Erling Haaland?; Bayer Leverkusen chasing Arda Güler; and MORE!
arts.sum: Bayern Munich took the road trip up to Gelsenkirchen and faced a game Shakhtar Donetsk side that was not like some recent contests for the Bavarians. In added time after the 45th minute, Bayern Munich was able to extend its lead with Thomas Müller’s 55th career Champions League goal.

arts.ttl: On Fire: Bayern Munich’s Jamal Musiala continues torrid run of play in Champions League win over Shakhtar Donetsk
arts.sum: Bayern Munich star Jamal Musiala knew Shakhtar Donetsk was going to bring a lot of energy and a tough style of play to his team’s 5-1 win over the Ukrainian power in the Champions League . Looking for more thoughts and analysis on Bayern Munich’s big 5-1 win over Shakhtar Donetsk in the Champions League ?

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich’s Konrad Laimer in awe of Michael Olise’s “video game” goal against Shakhtar Donetsk
arts.sum: Without the specialty penalty kick services of Harry Kane, Olise was the first man up when Sacha Boey was fouled in the box by a Shakhtar Donetsk defender. Olise is usually pretty shy with his accomplishments, but Bayern teammate Konrad Laimer was happy to tell reporter Julian Buhl how great the moment was.

arts.ttl: Five Observations from Bayern Munich’s 5-1 Champions League win over Shakhtar Donetsk
arts.sum: It was a good solid win from a Bayern Munich team that was clearly the better of the two sides today. It did not always look like it would end that way — a smash-and-grab early from Shakhtar Donetsk’s Kevin, followed later by a chance for the ‘home’ side to regain the lead...even a harshly disallowed set piece goal from Jamal Musiala for a phantom foul on the goalkeeper.

arts.ttl: Thomas Müller pleased with Bayern Munich’s attacking and pressing against Shakhtar Donetsk
arts.sum: Bayern Munich overcame an early scare against Shakhtar Donetsk en route to a 5-1 romp in the Champions League . A noticeable trait of the team is the consistent ability to respond to things like an early conceded goal, something Thomas Müller pointed out.

arts.ttl: Match Awards from Bayern Munich’s thrilling 5-1 Champions League win over Shakhtar Donetsk
arts.sum: Michael Olise led the way with a brace while Jamal Musiala, Thomas Müller, and Konrad Laimer also scored in a variety of ways. The 21-year old winger opened the scoring in the 5th minute by sneaking behind the Bayern defense, turning Kim Min-jae inside out, and calmly slotting his shot into the corner of the net.

arts.ttl: Bavarian Podcast Works: Postgame Show — Shakhtar Donetsk 1-5 Bayern Munich (Champions League)
arts.sum: Michael Olise scored twice, while Konrad Laimer, Thomas Müller, and Jamal Musiala each had goals in a dominant effort from the Bavarians. Be sure to stay tuned to Bavarian Podcast Works for all of your up to date coverage on Bayern Munich and Germany.

arts.ttl: Kompany reacts to Bayern's win over Shakhtar
arts.sum: Vincent Kompany was delighted with his FC Bayern side's "dominant" performance in Tuesday's 5-1 win over Shakhtar.

arts.ttl: Bayern recover from early shock to ease past Shakhtar
arts.sum: Goals from four different players sent Bayern Munich past Shakhtar Donetsk in the Champions League after a shock start.
